OAuth.description:
You need to send the OAuth parameter as a header parameter and then use it as a __bearer token__ in your requests. Use the [__User Info Endpoint__](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/61d8f18097b4e-user-information) to fetch user related information: `https://accounts.salla.sa/oauth2/user/info`.

Read More on:

- [Authorization Documentation Reference](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/ZG9jOjI0NTA0MzI3-authorization)
- [OAuth in Action](https://salla.dev/blog/oauth-2-0-in-action-with-salla/)
- [OAuth using Postman](https://salla.dev/blog/oauth-2-using-postman/)

Customer.description: Detailed structure of the customer model object showing its fields and data types.
Customer.title: Customer

id.description: Customer's ID refers to the unique identification assigned to an individual customer.

mobile.description: The numerical contact information belonging to a customer that allows communication via telephone, without country code.

mobile_code.description: The numeric prefix indicating a customer's country for mobile communication.

email.description: Email address of the customer used for electronic communication.

avatar.description: Image representing the customer, often a personal photograph or avatar.

gender.description: The categorization of an individual as male, female, based on their  biologically determined characteristics.

timezone_type.description: Time zone designation for date of b.

city.description: The city where the customer resides.

country.description: The nation of origin or residence of the customer.

country_code.description: Numeric code representing a customer's country for international identification.

currency.description: The currency used by the customer for transactions.

location.description: The geographic point where the customer is situated.

groups.description: A unique identifier for a group to which a customer belongs.

CustomerGroup.description: Detailed structure of the customer group model object showing its fields and data types.
CustomerGroup.title: Customer Group

id.description: Customer group ID refers to a unique identifier assigned to a specific group of customers for analytical purposes

name.description: The designated name or label for a the Customer Group

conditions.description:
The conditions that must apply to be member of the group
Expample: 'total_sales > 100', meaning if the customer have sales more than 100, then he may enter this group

Theses conditions in the case of auto assigning customers to group.

symbol.description: A symbol or function used in programming or logic to establish relationships between values or expressions, enabling the creation of conditional statements and decision-making processes.

id.description: A Webhook ID is a distinct code assigned to a webhook, enabling communication between different software applications.

name.description: Webhook name is the designated label or identifier assigned to a webhook, which is used to recognize and differentiate it from other webhooks in a system.

event.description: Webhook event refers to a specific occurrence or action that triggers a webhook to send data from one application to another in real-time ( one from events list ).

url.description: Webhook URL is the web address where a webhook sends its data when a predefined event occurs, allowing communication between different software systems.

version.description: indicates the specific iteration or edition of a webhook, which may encompass changes, updates, or enhancements made over time to its functionality or structure; either valued as `1` or `2`

rule.description: Operations, expressions and conditions to your webhook. For example, you may use `=`,`!=`,`AND`,`OR` etc in such a menner: `payment_method = YOUR_PAYMENT_METHOD` or in combination `payment_method = mada OR price < 50`. That adds more capbility to filter the response based on conditions

headers.description:
Webhook headers: Info attached to webhook requests, like authentication and content details, for secure and precise web service communication.
This contains `headers.key` and `headers.value`

Authorization.description: Any header key, along with its corresponding value, is sent within the POST request to the webhook URL.

Accept-Language.description: The value transmitted to the webhook, like this example: `cf-ray: 669af54ecf55dfcb-FRA`.

Tax.description: Detailed structure of the tax model object showing its fields and data types.
Tax.title: Tax

id.description: Tax ID is a unique identification number used for tax purposes, often associated with individuals or businesses.

tax.description: Tax rate refers to the percentage at which a specific tax is applied to a given amount of money or value.

status.description: Tax status indicates an individual or entity's position in relation to tax obligations, exemptions, and filing requirements.

country.description: The applicable country for taxation; utilize 'null' values to enforce taxes globally for all countries.

Payment.description: Detailed structure of the payment model object showing its fields and data types.
Payment.title: Payment

id.description: A Payment ID is a distinctive code assigned to a particular payment option, enabling precise tracking and management of transactions in a payment system.

slug.description: A Payment Slug is a concise label or identifier used to represent a specific payment option, aiding in streamlined tracking and management of transactions within a payment system.

name.description: A Payment Name is a concise label for a payment option, aiding recognition and organization within a payment system.

Product.description: Detailed structure of the product model object showing its fields and data types.
Product.title: Product

name.description: A Product Name is a succinct label for a specific item, aiding in easy identification and categorization within a product listing.

price.description: Product price is the specified cost assigned to a particular item, determining its value in a commercial transaction.

status.description: Product status refers to the current condition or state of availability of a particular item within a product catalog or inventory. Available values 'hidden','sale','out'.

product_type.description: Product type categorizes items based on shared attributes or characteristics, aiding in effective organization and search within a product inventory. Available values are, 'product', 'service', 'group_products', 'codes', 'digital', 'food', and 'donating'

quantity.description: Product quantity indicates the numerical count of a specific item available in inventory, representing its availability for sale or distribution.

unlimited_quantity.description: Display whether this product has an infinite quantity or is limited.

description.description: A product description provides detailed information about an item, helping customers understand its features, benefits, and intended use.

categories.description: A group of category IDs that connect to the product, defining its placement within different classifications for improved organization and customer discovery.

sale_price.description: Product sale price is the reduced cost assigned to an item for a limited period, typically during a promotional offer or sale event.

cost_price.description: Product cost price refers to the expense incurred to acquire, produce, or manufacture a specific item before any additional expenses or profit margins are applied.

sale_end.description: Product sale end indicates the conclusion of a promotional period during which an item is available for purchase at a discounted or sale price.

require_shipping.description: Require shipping indicates whether the product necessitates a physical delivery process or can be provided digitally without shipping

maximum_quantity_per_order.description: Maximum product quantity for a single order.

weight.description: The weight of the order represented in numerical form if applicable.

sku.description: Stock Keeping Unit is a unique alphanumeric code used to identify and manage specific products within a company's inventory system.

enable_upload_image.description: The option to allow uploading an image for a product when adding it to their cart.

enable_note.description: The option to add a note to a product when adding product to the cart.

pinned.description: The is used to indicate if the product is pinned in the categories page.

active_advance.description: Option to enable product active advance.

subtitle.description: a brief additional description for a product that is displayed under product name in pages.

promotion_title.description: a concise label or heading used to highlight a specific promotion, sale, or special offer displayed in the main image.

metadata_title.description: Product SEO Metadata Title which is a concise label used to optimize search engine results and enhance the visibility of a product page.

metadata_description.description: A succinct summary crafted to enhance search engine optimization .

brand_id.description: Brand ID of the product is a unique identifier assigned to a specific brand, aiding in precise tracking and management of products associated with that brand.

tags.description: The Product tags are keywords or labels used to categorize and identify products for easier organization and search

ProductValue.description: Detailed structure of the product value model object showing its fields and data types.
ProductValue.title: Product Value

id.description: A Product Value ID is a unique identifier assigned to a specific value associated with a product, aiding in accurate tracking and management of product attributes and characteristics.

name.description: Identifying label for a product attribute.

price.description: The extra price added when a customer selects a specific value; use 0 to indicate no additional cost. Applicable for product types: service and food.

display_value.description: The UI shows the value based on the option's display type. By default, it uses the value's name when 'display_value=text'. If 'image' is used, set the value as the image ID (upload via attach image endpoint). For 'color' display, provide the color (e.g., '#000' for black).

option_id.description: Option ID is a unique identifier assigned to a specific choice or configuration available to customers, aiding in precise tracking and management of selectable product attributes.

image_url.description: When the option type is set to "image," the Value Image URL refers to the web address where the corresponding image is hosted.

hashed_display_value.description:
if `option.type` = `image` then hashed display value return `image id`. 
if `option.type` = `text` then hashed display value return value `name`

is_default.description: This option will be enabled when this particular value is the default value.

id.description: Category ID, is a unique identifier assigned to a specific product category, facilitating organized classification and efficient management of products within a similar group.

name.description: Category name is a descriptive label assigned to a product category, aiding in clear identification and organization of related products. ðŸŒ [Support multi-language](docs/1.%20Introduction/1.6.Multi-Language-Support.md)

parent_id.description: Category Parent ID refers to the unique identifier assigned to the parent category of a subcategory, establishing a hierarchical relationship between different levels of product classification.

sort_order.description: Sort order dictates the sequence or arrangement of categories when displayed to users. It determines the order in which categories are presented, often using numerical values to assign priority, allowing for controlled and organized navigation.

status.description: The category status indicates whether the category is currently visible and accessible to users `active` or intentionally concealed from view `hidden`. It essentially controls whether the category is publicly displayed or kept private within the system.

metadata_title.description: Category SEO Metadata Title which is a concise label used to optimize search engine results and enhance the visibility of a category page.

metadata_description.description: A succinct summary crafted to enhance search engine optimization and spotlight a brand's attributes within a category.

metadata_url.description: Metadata URL is a web address that contains information designed to improve a webpage's search engine visibility and shareability on social platforms.

id.description: Category ID is a unique identifier assigned to a specific product category, facilitating organized classification and efficient management of products within a similar group.

name.description: Category name is a descriptive label assigned to a product category, aiding in clear identification and organization of related products.

items.description: Category items that contains list of sub categories for this category

parent_id.description: Category Parent ID refers to the unique identifier assigned to the parent category of a subcategory, establishing a hierarchical relationship between different levels of product classification.

status.description: The category status indicates whether the category is currently visible and accessible to users `active` or intentionally concealed from view `hidden`. It essentially controls whether the category is publicly displayed or kept private within the system.

sort_order.description: Sort order dictates the sequence or arrangement of categories when displayed to users. It determines the order in which categories are presented, often using numerical values to assign priority, allowing for controlled and organized navigation.

SpecialOffer.description: Detailed structure of the special offer model object showing its fields and data types.
SpecialOffer.title: Special Offer

id.description: Special offer ID is a unique identifier associated with a particular promotional or discount offer, allowing for tracking and management of the offer within a system or database.

name.description: Special offer name is a descriptive label or title given to a specific promotional offer to distinguish it from others and make it easily recognizable to customers and within an organization's marketing or sales materials. ðŸŒ [Support multi-language](https://docs.salla.dev/studio/docs/1.%20Introduction/1.6.Multi-Language-Support.md)

message.description: A brief statement or communication that conveys the details or benefits of a specific promotional or discount offer. ðŸŒ [Support multi-language](https://docs.salla.dev/studio/docs/1.%20Introduction/1.6.Multi-Language-Support.md)

expiry_date.description: Special offer end date is the date when a specific promotional or discount offer expires or ends

start_date.description: Special offer start date  is the date when a specific promotional or discount offer begins or becomes active.

offer_type.description: Special offer type refers to the category or classification that describes the nature or characteristics of a particular promotion, discount, or deal.

status.description: Special Offer Status indicates the current condition or state of a specific promotional or discount offer, such as whether it is active, expired, or in a pending or inactive status.

show_price_after_discount.description: The option to show the price after discount.

show_discounts_table_message.description: The option to refers to show a message or information presented in a table format that displays various discounts, prices, or pricing tiers for different products, services, or items. This message may include details about discounts based on quantities purchased, membership levels, or other criteria.

buy.description: Specifics on items required for offer eligibility.

type.description: Product Type to buy to be eligible for the special offer. Required if `offer_type = buy_x_get_y`

quantity.description: Product Quantity to buy to be eligible for the special offer. Required if `offer_type = buy_x_get_y`

products.description: The Products to be purchased that are included in the special offer. Make sure to pass the Product IDs in an array. This field is mandatory when `buy.type` is set to `product`.

categories.description: The Categories included in the special offer. Make sure to pass the Category IDs in an array. This field is mandatory when `buy.type` is set to `category`.

get.description: Specifics of the offer.

discount_type.description: Discount Type to get if eligible for the special offer. Required if `offer_type = buy_x_get_y`

quantity.description: Product Quantity to get if eligible for the special offer. Required if `offer_type = buy_x_get_y`

products.description: The Products to get if eligible for the special offer that are included in the special offer. Make sure to pass the Product IDs in an array. This field is mandatory when `get.type` is set to `product`.

categories.description: The Categories included in the special offer. Make sure to pass the Product IDs in an array. This field is mandatory when `get.type` is set to `category`.

Branch.description: Detailed structure of the branch model object showing its fields and data types.
Branch.title: Branch

id.description: The unique identifier for a branch.

name.description: The title or label given to a specific branch,  It is used to distinguish one branch from another within a larger network. ðŸŒ [Support multi-language](https://docs.salla.dev/studio/docs/1.%20Introduction/1.6.Multi-Language-Support.md)

building_number.description: Building Number. Value length is 4 characters long

postal_code.description: Postal Code. Value length is 5 characters long

preparation_time.description: Needed time to get an order ready for shipping or pickup

is_open.description: Is Branch currently open or closed

closest_time.description: The time when the branch will be closed based on the request time. Each request may have a different value.

working_hours.description: Branch working hours. Required if `branch.type is "branch"`

is_default.description: Is this branch the default branch for all operations or not.

name.description: The official or commonly used name of a specific urban area or municipality within a country or region.

name_en.description: City name expressed in English characters.

Pagination.description: For a better response behavior as well as maintain the best security level, All retrieving API endpoints use a mechanism to retrieve data in chunks called pagination.  Pagination working by return only a specific number of records in each response, and through passing the page number you can navigate the different pages.
Pagination.title: Pagination

total.description: The total number of all results.

perPage.description: The number of results per page.

links.description: aArray of linkes to next and previous pages

OrderStatus.description: Detailed structure of the order status model object showing its fields and data types.
OrderStatus.title: Order Status

ProductDetails.description: Detailed structure of the Product model object showing its fields and data types.

sku.description: Stock Keeping Unit is a unique alphanumeric code used to identify and manage specific products within a company's inventory.

gtin.description: "Global Trade Item Number" (GTIN), a unique and standardized identifier used to uniquely represent products, items, or services in the global marketplace, to enable efficient tracking and management across supply chains and retail sectors.

require_shipping.description: Require shipping indicates whether the product necessitates a physical delivery process or can be provided digitally without shipping.

cost_price.description: Product cost price, the amount a business pays to acquire or manufacture a product before any additional expenses, such as overhead or markup, are applied

weight.description: The weight of the product represented in numerical form if applicable.

weight_type.description: The classification or unit of measurement used to specify the weight of an object or item, such as kilograms (kg), pounds (lb), ounces (oz), or grams (g).

with_tax.description: Option to indicate if a tax applied to this product or not.

url.description: The web address or hyperlink that leads to a specific product's page or information on the internet, allowing access details and potentially make a purchase online.

id.description: product image ID  is a unique identifier or code assigned to a specific product image within a database or system, enabling efficient management and retrieval of images associated with a product.

rating.description: Product rating details, include information about the ratings and reviews provided by customers for a specific product, including the average rating, individual reviews, and any associated comments or feedback, often used to gauge the product's quality and customer satisfaction.

total.description: Total quantity of  reviews or ratings that a specific product has received, which is often used as a metric to assess the popularity and credibility of the product.

count.description: Counted number of ratings to the product

rate.description: The numerical evaluation or score given to a product based on level of satisfaction.

max_items_per_user.description: The limit or cap set on the number of products that an individual user is allowed to have or purchase.

maximum_quantity_per_order.description: Maximum quantity per order for the customer or the maximum quantity for the product.

show_in_app.description: The option to show the product in the App.

hide_quantity.description: Determine the quantity of the product - boolean weather to hide the quantity or not.

channels.description: The product to appear in specific channels.

details.description: Comprehensive information about a specific payment processing service.

starting_price.description: The merchant owner should activate this feature from his store from [here](https://s.salla.sa/settings/component/options).

amount.description: Product starting price amount,the initial or base price at which a product is offered for sale, typically before any additional options, variations, or customizations are factored in, and it serves as the starting point for pricing.

id.description: Unique identifier or code assigned to a specific booking or reservation, used for tracking, reference, and management purposes

location.description: The specific place or venue where a booking or reservation is made, such as a hotel, restaurant, event venue, or transportation service.

overrides.description: Overwrite availability for a particular day, on a particular date.

date.description: The value of specific date that has been overridden in a booking

id.description: A unique identifier or code assigned to a specific tag or label used for categorization or classification purposes within a system or database.

products.description:
A list of products, that will be shipped. Using the `id`, you can pass an existing product, or you can create a custom product by passing the `name` and `price`.

Available product attributes:

| Variable Name | Type    | Description                                                    |
| ------------- | ------- | -------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `id`          | `integer` | The ID of the product. 'requiredIf' it is an existing product. |
| `name`        | `string`  | The name of the product. 'requiredIf' it is a custom product.  |
| `price`       | `number` | The price of the product. 'requiredIf' it is a custom product. |
| `quantity`    | `integer` | The amount of the product. |

coupon.description: Codes that can be redeemed for discounts or other benefits when making a purchase.

ShipmentsResponse.title: Shipments Response
ShipmentsResponse.description: This schema describes a model for a shipment response, including details about shipments made by a courier service, their associated orders, and shipment properties like ID, type, courier, tracking info, payment method, source, and status, as well as package details like name, SKU, price, quantity, and weight. Other info, such as creation date, currency, and trackability, is also included in the response, returned as **an array of objects** for use in a RESTful API for querying shipment data.

post.description:
Customers can be created within your store at Salla by providing the required data in this endpoint. 

You may need the [Countries List](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/b3A6ODUwMzM4-list-countries) endpoint to get the mobile and country codes.

Also, you may use the [Customer Groups list](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/b3A6NTU1NzcwNg-list-customer-groups) to add the group's IDs for the new customer. Kindly note that customer's email and mobile number are unique.

get.description: You can list all customers related to your store directly from this endpoint. Also, it allows you to filter them using a keyword, the endpoint would retrieve any customer matches this keyword in their data whether in their mobile number or email or name.

200.description: Array of Customers and their corresponding informations

get.description: you can return a specific customer's Details by providing the ID of the customer you want to get his details in the *customer* path parameter.

200.description: Successful query of information of a specific customer

error.message: The content you are trying to access is no longer available

put.description:
Update a customer using this Endpoint. Provide the ID of the customer you want to update in the *customer* path parameter. The response will be all the customer updated data.

>ðŸ’¡ __Note__
>
> The existing value of all skipped parameters will remain unchanged.

You can use this endpoint to ban (Add to blacklist) one of your customers by providing the ID of the customer you want to ban in the *customer* path parameter.

Banned customer won't be able to create new orders. 

>ðŸ’¡ __Note__
>
>Banned customers can login to the store.

post.description:
This Endpoint allows you to create customer groups by providing the group name which is required and the conditions (similarities between group members) and the features that the group members will have.

**type** may be one of these 
1. total_sales
2. total_orders
3. store_rating
4. doesnt_have_orders
 
and the **symbols** may be one of these
1. '>'
2. '<'
3. 'between'

>ðŸ’¡ __Note__
>
>To add the payment methods you will need to get the payment methods list from [Payment](../~1payment~1methods/get) Endpoint

get.description: This endpoint allows you to list all the customer groups in your store. Customer groups are aiming to divide customers into smaller groups instead of the default customers group to be able to serve them better and to determine their needs and also give each group special treatment.

200.description: A successful call returns a payload that contains a current list of the store customers groups

post.description:
This endpoint allows you to create Single Coupon, and Group Coupons.

<!-- theme: warning -->
> ðŸ’¡ __Note__
>
> Although the response payload you will be receiving of the two coupon-types at once, each has its own required Body Requests.

<!--
type: tab
title: Single Coupon
-->

When creating a `Single Coupon`, ensure that you are sending the following required variables:

| Attribute | Type | Is Required |
| -- | -- | -- |
| `code` | string | Yes |
| `type` | string | Yes |
| `amount` | number | Yes |
| `free_shipping` | boolean | Yes |
| `expiry_date` | string | Yes |
| `exclude_sale_products` | boolean | Yes |

If `marketing_active` is valued as `true`, then when creating `Marketing Coupons`, ensure that you are sending the following required variables:

| Attribute | Type | Is Required |
| -- | -- | -- |
| `marketing_active` | boolean | Yes |
| `marketing_name` | string | Yes |
| `marketing_type` | string | Yes |
| `marketing_amount` | number | Yes |




<!--
type: tab
title: Group Coupons
-->

If `is_group` is valued as `true`, then when creating `Group Coupons`, ensure that you are sending the following required variables:

| Attribute | Type | Is Required |
| -- | -- | -- |
| `is_group` | boolean | Yes |
| `group_coupons_count` | number | Yes |
| `group_suffix` | string | Yes |
| `group_name` | string | Yes |
| `type` | string | Yes |
| `amount` | number | Yes |
| `free_shipping` | boolean | Yes |
| `expiry_date` | string | Yes |
| `exclude_sale_products` | boolean | Yes |

If `marketing_active` is valued as `true`, then when creating `Marketing Coupons`, ensure that you are sending the following required variables:

| Attribute | Type | Is Required |
| -- | -- | -- |
| `marketing_active` | boolean | Yes |
| `marketing_name` | string | Yes |
| `marketing_type` | string | Yes |
| `marketing_amount` | number | Yes |


<!-- type: tab-end -->
